intro: Hieracium laevigatum subsp. lygodes, commonly known as the smooth hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with upright, hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often lobed. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, producing small seeds that are dispersed by wind. It is often found in disturbed soils and can form dense mats in open habitats.
